typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "RefundEscrow: beneficiary is the zero address"

arguments.value: RefundEscrow: beneficiary is the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "RefundEscrow: beneficiary is the zero address"

documentation.text:
@dev Constructor.
 @param beneficiary The beneficiary of the deposits.
@return The current state of the escrow.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "RefundEscrow: can only deposit while active"

arguments.value: RefundEscrow: can only deposit while active

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "RefundEscrow: can only deposit while active"

documentation.text:
@dev Stores funds that may later be refunded.
 @param refundee The address funds will be sent to if a refund occurs.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "RefundEscrow: can only close while active"

arguments.value: RefundEscrow: can only close while active

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "RefundEscrow: can only close while active"

documentation.text:
@dev Allows for the beneficiary to withdraw their funds, rejecting
 further deposits.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "RefundEscrow: can only enable refunds while active"

arguments.value: RefundEscrow: can only enable refunds while active

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "RefundEscrow: can only enable refunds while active"

documentation.text: @dev Allows for refunds to take place, rejecting further deposits.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "RefundEscrow: beneficiary can only withdraw while closed"

arguments.value: RefundEscrow: beneficiary can only withdraw while closed

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "RefundEscrow: beneficiary can only withdraw while closed"

documentation.text:
@dev Returns whether refundees can withdraw their deposits (be refunded). The overridden function receives a
 'payee' argument, but we ignore it here since the condition is global, not per-payee.
